content: Not enough businesses on it. Many still using pen and paper.
Good job Canberra! This is more in line with the privacy requirements than signing a sheet of paper.
Becoming more useful as more businesses sign up. (Didn't work at the Museum of Australia a few weeks ago. Had to scan the code and sign in the old way. Where is it supposed to operate?)
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, the app works at participating businesses across the ACT region.

content: Works for some places, not others, it just says enter manually code

replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. This may be an internet connection issue. If you continue to have difficulties please contact us at Digital.Support@act.gov.au

content: Didn't download while I was at the venue. Now I don't have the QR code so cannot check in. What's wrong with QR link to a webpage? That works well. This app just adds failure.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Once you have done the initial download of the app it is an easy check-in at participating businesses on arrival. The app provides increased security for user data and phishing protection than that of a QR code website.

content: Works really well, much better than using a google form
The App has not changed to daylight savings.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We have updated the app to resolve this issue.

content: Easy to use but don't just scan QR and expect app to open. The QR does nothing but open a website, thats what they mostly do. Scanning a QR will just take you to website to download. It will not open app. Once I downloaded app and added my details, I clicked check in and then I scanned the QR (after giving app permission) Easy.
Samsung GS7 will not scan QR code. App has camera permission enabled. Phone will scan QR codes, but not in this app. Fixed! Thanks! App now returns "Not a check in CBR code" on invalid QR scans
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We have updated the app to inform you if the QR code is supported.

content: Poor. Three venues in a row where the QR code isn't recognised.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, the app works at participating venues across the ACT region. We have updated the app to inform you if the QR code is supported.

content: Had my first chance to use it yesterday but the QR code would not scan (Oppo R9s). Does this app require internet connection when scanning the QR code? I had my data switched off and the app did not indicate it needed to be enabled.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We have updated the app to provide additional messaging that an internet connection is required when scanning the QR code.

content: Quick and easy to use, really good!

Much quicker and easier to use than scanning a QR code to click to load a website and manually entering your details. Better security is a plus too, it'd be hard to tell if random QR code is linking to a legit website or not.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Usability and cyber security factors underpin the design and build of the app. It’s great to hear that you have found this useful.

content: Scanning opens a link asking you to install the app - even if you have it. A couple more clicks to open the app and click 'Check In', and you'll need to go back to the front door and scan the QR code again from within the app. Unlike other quick and easy QR check ins, scanning the code from your camera will NOT simply open the app/site AND recognise the venue you're trying to check into. You have to realise the venue is using THIS app, open the app, then scan; OR scan, fiddle and scan again.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. The QR code was intentionally designed within the app as it provides stronger security of user information.

content: Won't download - at Majura Park. Finished lunch - still trying to download ...
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. This may be an internet connection issue. If you continue to have difficulties please contact us at Digital.Support@act.gov.au

content: Very easy to use and intuitive. Looks clean and professional too.
